Sequence Information.Peptide Name: T15-am (Synthetic AMPs, Tritrpticin analog, Arg-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 86.67% similar toTritrpticin. R: 40%, W: 20%, P=F: 13%.Activity: Active against E. coli KCTC 1682 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. typhimurium KCTC 1926 (MIC 16 ug/ml),  B. subtilis KCTC 3068 (MIC 4 ug/ml), and S. aureus KCTC 1621 (MIC 8 ug/ml). Non-standard assays in 50% LB.MOA: lysed more anionic liposomes than zwitterionic liposomes.In vitro toxicity: human RBC (4%): HC50 60.9 uM.
Literature Information.Author: Yang ST, Shin SY, Hahm KS, Kim JI. 2006
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Antimicrob Agents. 2006 Apr;27(4):325-30. doi: 10.1016/j.ijantimicag.2005.11.014.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Design of perfectly symmetric Trp-rich peptides with potent and broad-spectrum antimicrobial activities.
